result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan C Krupp

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:33 AM Defendant Ryan C Krupp in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Ryan C Krupp.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Parties are in trial posture.
Defense has filed a  motion to suppress.
Defense received blood test results which may change defense perspective and may result in the State amending one of the charges.
State moves to dismiss Count 2.
BTC: Count 2 dismissed.  Amended information to be filed.
Defense requesting Miranda/Goodchild hearing.
Defense states that defendant would be willing to withdraw DST and stipulate to lowering bond so defendant can get into the vivitrol program.  Parties are close to resolution as well and are requesting the trial to be rescheduled.
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his request to withdraw his demand for speedy trial.
BTC: Defendant knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily withdraws his request for a speedy trial.  Set for a new trial date. Cash bond in 21CF1748 modified to $1,000 cash, same conditions.
Defense moves to modify condition of bond for no house arrest or scram monitoring or be given a curfew of house arrest.
State obj.
BTC: Bond modified to having SCRAM unit installed, random drug/alcohol testing.  GPS/House Arrest to be removed.  Do not drive.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Krupp in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Ryan C Krupp. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense makes ORAL demand for speedy trial on all 3 cases.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Krupp in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Ryan C Krupp. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Matter here for bond motion by defense.
Defense moves to have bond modified to $1000 cash total between all three cases.
State obj.
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied.
Bail/bond hearing on May 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.
NG plea entered.

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Krupp appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Ryan C Krupp. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Defense would like to be heard on bond, filed a motion on all 3 files to lower the amount of cash needed. Plans have been made for defendant to undergo a treatment plan for addiction. 
BTC: only 22CF460 is on the Calendar today, Court will only hear bond motion on this file.
State objects to modification at this time with argument.
BTC: Bond motion in 22CF460 granted, bond modified to $400 cash, and 5000 signature. defendant cannot drive AT ALL. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records without Extrinsic Evidence, by the State.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan C Krupp appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Ryan C Krupp. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
